newsitem.title: BRAZIL: Brazil shares end slightly off in moderate trade.
newsitem.headline: Brazil shares end slightly off in moderate trade.

text.p: Brazil stocks ended slightly off on Wednesday after three days of rises in a row, in listless trade, with analysts betting on Thursday's session will be pretty much the same, brokers said.
The Sao Paulo bourse's Bovespa index .BVSP of the 49 most traded shares closed down 0.9 percent at 63,581 points.
Benchmark Telebras preferred fell 0.64 percent to close at 78 reais, while its common stock dropped 0.32 percent, ending at 62.70 reais.
Analysts said the market needs an injection of fresh money to move from current levels. Today's volume was a moderate 340.4 million reais ($334.2 million).
Until very recently, market's average daily volume was $400-$500 million.
Sao Paulo bourse's Energy Electrical Index IEE, comprising the nine most liquid stocks of the power sector, fell 0.71 percent, closing at 1,587 points.
-- Fatima Cristina, Sao Paulo bourse newsroom, 55-11-2324411
